main event: On 2 August 1948, an attorney and his wife observed a round, 20 to 30-foot diameter object with a transparent center and a constant grey-black perimeter, moving at a slow and regular speed from North to South over Columbus, Ohio. The object changed shape from oblong to circular and then back to oblong while emitting a thin trail of smoke at one point. It made no noise, and the observation lasted for 10-15 minutes.
interesting points: The object changed shape from oblong to circular and then back to oblong, and emitted a thin trail of smoke at one point.
The altitude of the object was estimated to be between 1,500 to 2,000 feet above the ground.
The observation lasted for 10-15 minutes, and the object was judged to be moving at about 15 miles per hour.
The object had a transparent center, through which the blue sky could be observed, with a constant grey-black perimeter.
The object appeared to be moving at a slow and regular speed, with no sound, over a city with unusually clear weather.
sighted object: round, 20 to 30-foot diameter object with a transparent center and a constant grey-black perimeter
photographs: The report includes sketches of the object
